intro: Orthopogon, commonly known as the spikegrass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and are characterized by their slender, grass-like appearance. Orthopogon species often have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. They are generally herbaceous and may form dense mats or tufts in their native habitats. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in ecological restoration due to their ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
